q: I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no body, but I come alive with wind. What am I?
You measure my life in hours and I serve you by expiring. I'm quick when I'm thin and slow when I'm fat. The wind is my enemy.
I have cities, but no houses. I have mountains, but no trees. I have water, but no fish. What am I?
What is seen in the middle of March and April that can't be seen at the beginning or end of either month?
I see you without eyes. I move without legs. I push down trees but you cannot see me. What am I?
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What are they?
What has a head and a tail but no body?
What comes once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?
I have keys but no locks. I have a space but no room. You can enter, but never go outside. What am I?
What belongs to you, but other people use it more than you?
I am not alive, but I grow; I don't have lungs, but I need air; I don't have a mouth, but water kills me. What am I?
What can travel all around the world without leaving its corner?
I run all around the backyard, yet I never move. What am I?
What gets wet while drying?
The person who makes it has no need of it; the person who buys it has no use for it. The person who uses it can neither see nor feel it. What is it?
I have lakes with no water, mountains with no stone and cities with no buildings. What am I?
What has 13 hearts, but no other organs?

I turn polar bears white and I will make you cry. I make guys have to pee and girls comb their hair. I make celebrities look like normal people and normal people look like celebrities. I turn pancakes brown and make your champane bubble. If you squeeze me, I'll pop. If you look at me, you'll pop. Can you guess the riddle?
A man looks at a painting in a museum and says, 'Brothers and sisters I have none, but that man's father is my father's son.' Who is in the painting?
What is always coming, but never arrives?
What goes up but never comes down?
I have holes in my top and bottom, my left and right, and in the middle. But I still hold water. What am I?
What has a thumb and four fingers, but is not alive?
What has a neck but no head?
I am so fragile that if you say my name you break me. What am I?
If you have me, you want to share me. If you share me, you haven't got me. What am I?
The more of this there is, the less you see. What is it?
What has words, but never speaks?
What has one eye, but can’t see?
What has legs, but doesn’t walk?
What has a bed but never sleeps?
What has a bark, but no bite?
What comes down but never goes up?
What is black when you buy it, red when you use it, and grey when you throw it away?
I shave every day, but my beard stays the same. What am I?
If I drink, I die. If I eat, I am fine. What am I?
Throw away the outside and cook the inside, then eat the outside and throw away the inside. What is it?
What begins with T, ends with T, and has T in it?
I am an odd number. Take away a letter and I become even. What number am I?
What five-letter word becomes shorter when you add two letters to it?
What is the end of everything?
What word is spelled wrong in the dictionary?
Mary’s father has five daughters: Nana, Nene, Nini, Nono. What is the fifth daughter’s name?
I have no life, but I can die. What am I?
I have a ring but no finger. What am I?
I can fly but have no wings. I can cry but I have no eyes. What am I?
I am always hungry, I must always be fed. The finger I lick will soon turn red. What am I?
What loses its head in the morning and gets it back at night?
What can you hold in your left hand but not in your right?
What is black and white and read all over?
What invention lets you look right through a wall?
What can you break, even if you never pick it up or touch it?
A girl fell off a 20-foot ladder. She wasn't hurt. Why?
correct: She fell off the bottom rung

q: You see a boat filled with people, yet there isn’t a single person on board. How?
What has many teeth, but can’t bite?
What is cut on a table, but is never eaten?
I can be cracked, made, told, and played. What am I?
What is harder to catch the faster you run?
Three doctors said that Bill was their brother. Bill says he has no brothers. How?
A man went out in the rain without a hat or umbrella but didn't get a single hair on his head wet. How?
What starts with a P, ends with an E, and has thousands of letters?
What has 4 legs in the morning, 2 in the afternoon, and 3 in the evening?
What can go through a glass pane without breaking it?
What is always in front of you but can’t be seen?
There is a house. One enters it blind and comes out seeing. What is it?
Forward I am heavy, but backward I am not. What am I?
What builds up castles, tears down mountains, blinds some, helps others see?
I am weightless, but you can see me. Put me in a bucket, and I'll make it lighter. What am I?
You can drop me from the tallest building and I'll be fine, but if you drop me in water I die. What am I?
I have no eyes, no legs, and no ears, but I can move the earth. What am I?
What is greater than God, more evil than the devil, the poor have it, the rich need it, and if you eat it, you'll die?
What has a bank but no money?
What has a head but cannot think?
What has a face but cannot smile?
I am a seed, three letters in name. Take away two and I sound quite the same. What am I?
What goes through towns and hills but never moves?
What has a spine but no bones?
What can fill a room but takes up no space?
I am taken from a mine, and shut up in a wooden case, from which I am never released, and yet I am used by almost every person. What am I?
What has 88 keys but can't open a single door?
What has hands, but can’t clap?
What has many eyes, but cannot see?
What has one head, one foot and four legs?
What can you keep after giving to someone?
What gets bigger the more you take away?
What goes up a chimney down, but can't go down a chimney up?
What flies without wings?
What has a tongue, cannot walk, but gets around a lot?
What falls, but does not break, and what breaks, but does not fall?
I am rarely touched but often held, and if you have wit, you'll use me well. What am I?
What is it that given one, you'll have either two or none?
I can be hot, I can be cold, I can run, and I can be still, I can be hard and I can be soft. What am I?
What is 3/7 chicken, 2/3 cat and 2/4 goat?
I start with M, end with X, and have a never ending amount of letters. What am I?
What has 18 legs and catches flies?
What kind of coat is best put on wet?
What has a horn but does not honk?
What buys a lot of things, but can't buy itself?
What gets broken without being held?
I have branches, but no fruit, trunk or leaves. What am I?
What has no beginning, end, or middle?
Every night I’m told what to do, and each morning I do what I’m told. But I still don’t escape your scold. What am I?
The more you take away, the bigger I become. What am I?
What goes up and down but never moves?
